hypothesis_content.title: Post-Liquidity-Crash Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a 'liquidity crash' event (daily volume drop ≥35% from 20-day average), when 3-day realized volatility compresses to ≤50% of its 20-day average, the subsequent expansion in volatility will be directional, with the breakout direction determined by whether price is above/below the volume-weighted average price (VWAP) from the low-volume period.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity crashes create information asymmetry. Subsequent volatility compression represents equilibrium searching. The VWAP during compression acts as a 'fair price' consensus - breaks away from it indicate which side (bulls/bears) won the information battle during low liquidity.
entry_conditions: Crypto total volume drops ≥35% below 20-day average (liquidity crash)
Compression occurs within 5 days of liquidity crash
If price > VWAP (last 3 days): long setup
If price < VWAP (last 3 days): short setup
Entry on break of 3-day high (long) or low (short)

exit_conditions.take_profit: When 3-day realized volatility expands to ≥100% of 20-day average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If post-compression breakouts show no directional edge (≈50% win rate) or frequently reverse immediately after the initial break.
